span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium;

color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 16pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

h3.span: Frequently Asked Questions - Families and Community Partners

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Camden City School District Response to Coronavirus (COVID-19)

span.style: color: rgb(255, 0, 0); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: April 2, 2020

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium;

td.style: background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Continued Learning through Remote Learning

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: The digital divide is far greater than just students

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: not

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: having laptops, how will the District address the digital divide?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: The digital divide is more than just an access issue to technology; rather there are other factors at play; including, information accessibility and how the information is utilized.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: The District is exploring the option of using Chanel 19 to broadcast lessons on a daily basis. In addition to that, we are continuing to post information on our website, and teachers are connecting with at least four students per day by phone. Many teachers are using Class Dojo and Google Classroom to connect with students.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: How do we support students who do not learn well without an educator on site now that we are likely moving to a completely online platform?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Now more than ever, we know and understand the value of teachers around the world. We value the daily guidance and structure that teachers provide to our students. In the current situation we find ourselves, students all across the State and nation are home and not in a physical school building. While we cannot replace the physical instruction and guidance that our teachers provide each day, our teachers will be accessible to students daily to support remote learning through phone calls and video chats.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: I am a student who uses my cell phone for remote learning; however, it is becoming frustrating to complete my work with just a cell phone.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: We understand that having your cell phone crash during an online lesson can be frustrating. As we begin to deploy Chromebooks, completing and submitting assignments will be easier. Teachers are working closely with their students and are being flexible with the way in which students can submit work.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: We encourage students (and parents) to reach out to your teacher if you have concerns and questions about submitting your assignments.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: When will additional work packets be provided for students who have completed the first two weeks of assignments?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Academic plans will be released on April 1st via our website and through the digital platforms teachers are currently using. If you are in need of printed materials, please contact your child’s teacher.

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

a.span: All of the resources are digital and linked in the plans.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: I am looking forward to receiving learning materials via Channel 19. However, if I do not have Comcast, what channel would we find the TV station?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Students will be able to receive virtual lessons in a variety of ways. Comcast is channel 19; Verizon is channel 30. All videos are also posted on the District’s YouTube and FaceBook pages.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: My child recently got incarcerated, how can I get his work?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Student and/or parent should reach out to Ms. Genesis Polanco at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: or Ms. Cammie Nathaniel at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: . When contacting these individuals, identify the student’s name and name of school. Ms. Polanco and Ms. Nathaniel will coordinate with the school counselor to receive remote work assignments.

td.style: background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Questions about Grading, State Testing, Graduation, and School Events

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: What will the grading policy be for the third marking period?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: All students will receive the grades they earned for the third marking period. The grading for the third marking period

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: will follow the District’s normal grading policy.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: The third marking period ends on April 8, 2020. Parents will be able to view student’s third marking period grades using the Parent portal for Genesis by April 27. To access your child’s grades,

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: (in English and Spanish) If you have any questions about how to access the grades, you can contact your school’s Family Operations Coordinator.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: What is the grading policy for the fourth marking period?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Like many districts across New Jersey, we are hopeful that the New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE) will provide all districts with the appropriate guidance regarding grading policies and procedures for the fourth marking period.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: We will share updates as we receive guidance from the NJDOE.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Normally, I know my child is getting ready for state testing, the New Jersey Standardized Learning Assessment during the spring months. Is that testing still going to happen?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: In a letter to all district schools across New Jersey, Commissioner Repollet indicated that all state testing would be canceled for the 2019-2020 school year. Here is what that means for students:

li.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; list-style-type: disc;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt;

p.span: Cancellation of statewide assessments will not prevent students from meeting their graduation assessment requirements.

li.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; list-style-type: disc;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt;

p.span: The NJDOE will make the NJSLA available in the summer or fall for current high school freshman, sophomores, and juniors (and middle school students taking high-school level courses) who may want to use the NJSLA high school assessments to meet their graduation assessment requirements.

li.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; list-style-type: disc;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt;

p.span: Current juniors and sophomores also have access to the menu of alternate assessments (the PSAT, SAT, etc.) and the portfolio appeal process as pathways to complete their graduation assessment requirement.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: What will happen to school events such as the prom and field trips?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: I

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: n compliance with Executive Order 104, signed by Governor Murphy on March 16, 2020, and readopted by Executive Order 107, signed on March 21, 2020, all elementary and secondary schools, including charter and renaissance schools, are to remain closed to students for as long as these Orders remain in effect.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: To this end, if the schools remain closed until the end of the school year, there will be no further school programming or events, such as the prom and field trips, for the 2019-2020 school year. However, if the Governor lifts the Executive Orders and allows the resuming of schools, we will provide further guidance to all students and families at that time.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: I am a student that needs to submit a graduation appeal? How does the district closure impact me?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Seniors who require an appeal will still need to fulfill that requirement for graduation. At this time, the NJDOE is extending the submission deadline; however, this extension date has yet to be announced.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: We are working on a plan to have students complete the appeals remotely and waiting for further guidance from the NJDOE on the new electronic submission process. We will continue to keep students and families abreast of any updates concerning graduation appeals.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: What will happen with seniors graduating? How will the district closure affect graduation?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: While graduations as we know them have always been live and in-person where everyone can come together to celebrate the graduates, we may not be able to provide a graduation ceremony in the same way. However, we want all of our seniors to experience graduation. The district is currently working on creative solutions through virtual platforms that will allow our seniors to experience graduation. Be on the lookout for more information to come.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: What should a parent do who is currently holding the money collected from a school fundraiser?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: If you are a parent volunteer who collected money for your school’s fundraiser AND you currently still have the money, you must contact your school leader immediately. You and the school leader must work out an arrangement to have the money submitted to the business office ASAP.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: My school held a fundraiser before the district closed. How can I get my money back or the goods I paid for?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: If you participated in a fundraiser before the District closed on March 16 for students and you have not received the goods you paid for, we encourage you to contact your school’s Family Operations Coordinator.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: I am a student that needs working papers. How can I get my documents signed and certified?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: While the district is closed, working papers will be processed, signed and certified every Friday from 10AM - 12PM at the Central Office located at 1033 Cambridge Street.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Working papers will not be processed unless (1) the physician section of the form is completely filled out and (2) the student has an “Essential Worker” letter issued by the student’s employer.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: We will be working on processing working papers electronically - more details will be shared soon.

td.style: background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Questions about access to meals

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Will students have access to meals during the District’s spring break (April 13-17)?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: It was previously announced that the district would not provide meals during spring break; however, after much work and advocacy, we are excited to announce that meals

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: will be provided

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: during spring break.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: I am unable to pick up food from the meal sites, what is the best way to get a meal?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: If you are unable to get to a meal site to pick up food call the Solutions Center at 856-966-2507. A staff member will work with you to ensure you have access to the meals.

td.style: background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: Questions about Enrollment and Registration

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: I am currently considering different school options for my school-aged children. Will parents be provided additional time to accept or change schools using Camden Enrollment?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Camden Enrollment will extend the main round of enrollment to April 10. 2020. This extension will hopefully provide families the additional time to submit applications for the 2020-2021 school year. You can visit the Camden Enrollment website at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: for more information.

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 700;

p.span: My family is new to Camden, New Jersey. We have school-aged children and would like to register them in a traditional district school. How can I do that while the schools are currently closed?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: At this point in time we are working on creating an online process where families can complete registration and submit required documents. We hope for an option to be available in the near future. Continue to visit the district website for updates to this process.

div.style: border-width: 0px; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; left: 3px; top: 118px; width: 1px; height: 1px;

td.style: padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); overflow: hidden; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); overflow-wrap: break-word;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Continued Learning through Remote Learning

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: The digital divide is far greater than just students

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;

p.span: not

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: having laptops, how will the District address the digital divide?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: The digital divide is more than just an access issue to technology; rather there are other factors at play; including, information accessibility and how the information is utilized.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: The District is exploring the option of using Chanel 19 to broadcast lessons on a daily basis. In addition to that, we are continuing to post information on our website, and teachers are connecting with at least four students per day by phone. Many teachers are using Class Dojo and Google Classroom to connect with students.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: How do we support students who do not learn well without an educator on site now that we are likely moving to a completely online platform?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Now more than ever, we know and understand the value of teachers around the world. We value the daily guidance and structure that teachers provide to our students. In the current situation we find ourselves, students all across the State and nation are home and not in a physical school building. While we cannot replace the physical instruction and guidance that our teachers provide each day, our teachers will be accessible to students daily to support remote learning through phone calls and video chats.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: I am a student who uses my cell phone for remote learning; however, it is becoming frustrating to complete my work with just a cell phone.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: We understand that having your cell phone crash during an online lesson can be frustrating. As we begin to deploy Chromebooks, completing and submitting assignments will be easier. Teachers are working closely with their students and are being flexible with the way in which students can submit work.

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: We encourage students (and parents) to reach out to your teacher if you have concerns and questions about submitting your assignments.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: When will additional work packets be provided for students who have completed the first two weeks of assignments?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Academic plans will be released on April 1st via our website and through the digital platforms teachers are currently using. If you are in need of printed materials, please contact your child’s teacher.

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;

a.span: All of the resources are digital and linked in the plans.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: I am looking forward to receiving learning materials via Channel 19. However, if I do not have Comcast, what channel would we find the TV station?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Students will be able to receive virtual lessons in a variety of ways. Comcast is channel 19; Verizon is channel 30. All videos are also posted on the District’s YouTube and FaceBook pages.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: My child recently got incarcerated, how can I get his work?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Student and/or parent should reach out to Ms. Genesis Polanco at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;
font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: or Ms. Cammie Nathaniel at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;
font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: . When contacting these individuals, identify the student’s name and name of school. Ms. Polanco and Ms. Nathaniel will coordinate with the school counselor to receive remote work assignments.

td.style: padding: 5pt; border: 1pt solid rgb(0, 0, 0); overflow: hidden; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(217, 217, 217); overflow-wrap: break-word;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Questions about Grading, State Testing, Graduation, and School Events

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: What will the grading policy be for the third marking period?

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: All students will receive the grades they earned for the third marking period. The grading for the third marking period

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: will follow the District’s normal grading policy.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: The third marking period ends on April 8, 2020. Parents will be able to view student’s third marking period grades using the Parent portal for Genesis by April 27. To access your child’s grades,

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;

color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: (in English and Spanish) If you have any questions about how to access the grades, you can contact your school’s Family Operations Coordinator.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: What is the grading policy for the fourth marking period?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Like many districts across New Jersey, we are hopeful that the New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE) will provide all districts with the appropriate guidance regarding grading policies and procedures for the fourth marking period.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: We will share updates as we receive guidance from the NJDOE.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Normally, I know my child is getting ready for state testing, the New Jersey Standardized Learning Assessment during the spring months. Is that testing still going to happen?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: In a letter to all district schools across New Jersey, Commissioner Repollet indicated that all state testing would be canceled for the 2019-2020 school year. Here is what that means for students:

ul.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;

li.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; list-style-type: disc; white-space: pre; background-color: transparent;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Cancellation of statewide assessments will not prevent students from meeting their graduation assessment requirements.

li.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; list-style-type: disc; white-space: pre; background-color: transparent;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: The NJDOE will make the NJSLA available in the summer or fall for current high school freshman, sophomores, and juniors (and middle school students taking high-school level courses) who may want to use the NJSLA high school assessments to meet their graduation assessment requirements.

li.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; list-style-type: disc; white-space: pre; background-color: transparent;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Current juniors and sophomores also have access to the menu of alternate assessments (the PSAT, SAT, etc.) and the portfolio appeal process as pathways to complete their graduation assessment requirement.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: What will happen to school events such as the prom and field trips?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: I

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: n compliance with Executive Order 104, signed by Governor Murphy on March 16, 2020, and readopted by Executive Order 107, signed on March 21, 2020, all elementary and secondary schools, including charter and renaissance schools, are to remain closed to students for as long as these Orders remain in effect.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: To this end, if the schools remain closed until the end of the school year, there will be no further school programming or events, such as the prom and field trips, for the 2019-2020 school year. However, if the Governor lifts the Executive Orders and allows the resuming of schools, we will provide further guidance to all students and families at that time.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: I am a student that needs to submit a graduation appeal? How does the district closure impact me?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Seniors who require an appeal will still need to fulfill that requirement for graduation. At this time, the NJDOE is extending the submission deadline; however, this extension date has yet to be announced.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: We are working on a plan to have students complete the appeals remotely and waiting for further guidance from the NJDOE on the new electronic submission process. We will continue to keep students and families abreast of any updates concerning graduation appeals.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: What will happen with seniors graduating? How will the district closure affect graduation?

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: While graduations as we know them have always been live and in-person where everyone can come together to celebrate the graduates, we may not be able to provide a graduation ceremony in the same way. However, we want all of our seniors to experience graduation. The district is currently working on creative solutions through virtual platforms that will allow our seniors to experience graduation. Be on the lookout for more information to come.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: What should a parent do who is currently holding the money collected from a school fundraiser?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: If you are a parent volunteer who collected money for your school’s fundraiser AND you currently still have the money, you must contact your school leader immediately. You and the school leader must work out an arrangement to have the money submitted to the business office ASAP.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 72pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: My school held a fundraiser before the district closed. How can I get my money back or the goods I paid for?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

p.span: I am a student that needs working papers. How can I get my documents signed and certified?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: While the district is closed, working papers will be processed, signed and certified every Friday from 10AM - 12PM at the Central Office located at 1033 Cambridge Street.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Working papers will not be processed unless (1) the physician section of the form is completely filled out and (2) the student has an “Essential Worker” letter issued by the student’s employer.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: We will be working on processing working papers electronically - more details will be shared soon.

p.span: I am unable to pick up food from the meal sites, what is the best way to get a meal?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: If you are unable to get to a meal site to pick up food call the Solutions Center at 856-966-2507. A staff member will work with you to ensure you have access to the meals.

p.span: Questions about Enrollment and Registration

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: I am currently considering different school options for my school-aged children. Will parents be provided additional time to accept or change schools using Camden Enrollment?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: Camden Enrollment will extend the main round of enrollment to April 10. 2020. This extension will hopefully provide families the additional time to submit applications for the 2020-2021 school year. You can visit the Camden Enrollment website at

span.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-skip-ink: none;

color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: for more information.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: My family is new to Camden, New Jersey. We have school-aged children and would like to register them in a traditional district school. How can I do that while the schools are currently closed?

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: medium; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: transparent;

p.span: At this point in time we are working on creating an online process where families can complete registration and submit required documents. We hope for an option to be available in the near future. Continue to visit the district website for updates to this process.
